result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Successfully complete Anger Management counseling. Complete a parenting class. Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
No illegal substances.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or any child rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: As to both counts: This time is stayed pending a review (to be set by the agent if necessary).

judgments.dispoDesc: Felony CT 1 amended to two counts of Misd. Battery, stat, #940.19(1)(a).

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 7 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 
*
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review to be set by the agent if necessary.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-No illegal substances.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim or any child rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The 5/21/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no violent contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNT 1:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2:  Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in court with attorney Susan M. Roth.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
from Attorney Susan Roth received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
Court modifed to no contact order to a No Violent Contact Order.

Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in court with attorney Susan M. Roth.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMJ dob 12/18/02; Paula H and 1020 N 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Mark Dennis Hubanks in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
